items.label: lem-dynamics-regularity
items.title: Regularity of the MDLGT Dynamics
items.content:
147: :label: lem-dynamics-regularity
148: 
149: The MDLGT dynamics (constrained Langevin + heat bath) are well-defined on $\Sigma_N$ despite the fiber bundle singularities.
150: 
151: **Proof Sketch**:
152: 
153: 1. **Node dynamics well-defined**: The gradient $\nabla_{x_i} H$ exists and is bounded everywhere by {prf:ref}`lem-uniform-force-bounds`, since $H$ depends only on pairwise distances $\|x_i - x_j\|$ (smooth except at collisions, which are excluded by hard-core repulsion).
154: 
155: 2. **Topology changes have measure zero**: The constrained Langevin dynamics induce a continuous diffusion on $\mathcal{B}_N$. The set of co-spherical configurations is an algebraic variety of codimension $\geq 1$ in $\mathbb{R}^{4N}$, hence has Lebesgue measure zero. Under the diffusion, such sets are visited with probability zero.
156: 
157: 3. **Gauge field updates well-defined**: For any fixed node configuration $\mathbf{x}$, the heat bath algorithm samples from the conditional Boltzmann distribution on $(\text{SU}(N_c))^{E_N(\mathbf{x})}$, which is well-defined by compactness of SU($N_c$).

items.label: lem-uniform-force-bounds
items.title: Uniform Force Bounds
items.content:
551: :label: lem-uniform-force-bounds
552: 
553: For any configuration satisfying the hard-core constraint $\min_{i \neq j}\|x_i - x_j\| \geq r_{\min}$:
554: 
555: 1. **Node forces are uniformly bounded**:
556: 
557: $$
558: \sup_{\mathbf{x} : \min_{i \neq j}\|x_i - x_j\| \geq r_{\min}} \|\nabla_{x_i} H_{\text{nodes}}(\mathbf{x})\| \leq C_F(N) := (N-1) \sup_{r > 0} |V'_{\text{pair}}(r)| < \infty
559: 
560: $$
561: 
562: 2. **Gauge forces are bounded for any gauge field**:
563: 
564: $$
565: \sup_{\mathbf{x}, \mathbf{U} : \min_{i \neq j}\|x_i - x_j\| \geq r_{\min}} \|\nabla_{x_i} H_{\text{gauge}}(\mathbf{x}, \mathbf{U})\| \leq C_G(N, N_c, \beta_{\text{gauge}}, r_{\min}) < \infty
566: 
567: $$

items.label: lem-gauge-force-bound
items.title: Bounded Gradient of Plaquette Weights
items.content:
596: :label: lem-gauge-force-bound
597: 
598: For triangular plaquettes $\Delta$ in a Delaunay triangulation satisfying:
599: - Hard-core exclusion: edge lengths in $[r_{\min}, R_{\text{cut}}]$
600: - Shape regularity: aspect ratio $\rho(\Delta) \leq \rho_{\max}$, area $A(\Delta) \geq A_{\min}$
601: 
602: the gradient of the weight function $w(\Delta) = \exp(−(\rho(\Delta) − 1)^2/(2\sigma_{\text{shape}}^2))$ satisfies:
603: 
604: $$
605: \|\nabla_{x_i} w(\Delta)\| \leq C_w(\rho_{\max}, r_{\min}, R_{\text{cut}}, A_{\min}, \sigma_{\text{shape}})
606: 
607: $$

items.raw_directive:

items.label: lem-strong-coupling-random
items.title: Strong-Coupling Mass Gap for Shape-Regular Random Lattices
items.content:
830: :label: lem-strong-coupling-random
831: 
832: **Sketch: expansion into full proof in progress (estimated 30-50 pages)**
833: 
834: Consider an ensemble of lattices with the following properties:
835: - Bounded coordination $K$
836: - Edge lengths in $[r_{\min}, R_{\text{cut}}]$
837: - Simplex aspect ratio $\leq \rho_{\max}$
838: - Plaquette area $\geq A_{\min}$
839: 
840: Then there exists a critical coupling $\beta_c = \beta_c(K, r_{\min}, R_{\text{cut}}, \rho_{\max}, A_{\min}) > 0$ such that for all $\beta_{\text{gauge}} < \beta_c$, the ensemble-averaged Wilson loop observables satisfy:
841: 
842: $$
843: \mathbb{E}_{\text{lattice}}\left[\langle W_C \rangle_{\text{gauge}}\right] \leq e^{-\Delta_{\text{eff}} \cdot \text{Area}(C)}
844: 
845: $$
